availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: G. P. B. Johnston (Louisville, Kentucky, painter)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, painter. Indiana native. Married to Maria A. Dalton Johnston in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on August 11, 1831. Father of Franklin P. Johnston, John H. Johnston, Manlius B. Johnston, Maria G. Johnston, and Edmund S. Johnston. Painter in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Painter in Louisville in 1858. Painter in Louisville in 1860. Hired two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:

"G. P. B. Johnston (1811-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial 43672892 , accessed May 19, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43672892 .
